node.name: Common Commands
node.description: These commands are available on all VTY nodes. They are listed here only once, to unclutter the VTY reference.

param.name: help
param.doc: Description of the interactive help system

param.name: write
param.doc: Write running configuration to memory, network, or terminal

param.name: write
param.doc: Write running configuration to memory, network, or terminal

param.name: [PATH]
param.doc: Set file path to store the config, or replace if already exists

param.name: write
param.doc: Write running configuration to memory, network, or terminal

param.name: memory
param.doc: Write configuration to the file (same as write file)

param.name: write
param.doc: Write running configuration to memory, network, or terminal

param.name: exit
param.doc: Exit current mode and down to previous mode

param.name: end
param.doc: End current mode and change to enable mode.

param.name: length
param.doc: Set number of lines on a screen
Number of lines on screen (0 for no pausing)

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: length
param.doc: Set number of lines on a screen

param.name: all
param.doc: Do you want to log all messages?
Only print messages matched by other filters
Bypass filter and print all messages
Don't use color for printing messages
Prefix each log message with current timestamp
Prefix each log message with current timestamp with YYYYMMDDhhmmssnnn
Prefix each log message with category/subsystem name
Prefix each log message with category/subsystem nr in hex ('<000b>')
Prefix each log message with the log level name
Prefix each log message with the source file and line

param.name: basename
param.doc: Prefix each log message with the source file's basename (strip leading paths) and line

param.name: [last]
param.doc: Log source file info at the end of a log line. If omitted, log source file info just before the log text.

param.name: set-log-mask
param.doc: Set the logmask of this logging target

param.name: MASK
param.doc: List of logging categories to log, e.g. 'abc:mno:xyz'. Available log categories depend on the specific application, refer to the 'logging level' command. Optionally add individual log levels like 'abc,1:mno,3:xyz,5', where the level numbers are LOGL_DEBUG=1 LOGL_INFO=3 LOGL_NOTICE=5 LOGL_ERROR=7 LOGL_FATAL=8

param.name: level
param.doc: Set the log level for a specified category

param.name: debug
param.doc: Log debug messages and higher levels

param.name: info
param.doc: Log informational messages and higher levels

param.name: notice
param.doc: Log noticeable messages and higher levels

param.name: error
param.doc: Log error messages and higher levels

param.name: level
param.doc: Set the log level for a specified category

param.name: set-all
param.doc: Once-off set all categories to the given log level. There is no single command to take back these changes -- each category is set to the given level, period.

param.name: debug
param.doc: Log debug messages and higher levels

param.name: info
param.doc: Log informational messages and higher levels

param.name: notice
param.doc: Log noticeable messages and higher levels

param.name: error
param.doc: Log error messages and higher levels

param.name: level
param.doc: Set the log level for a specified category

param.name: force-all
param.doc: Globally force all logging categories to a specific level. This is released by the 'no logging level force-all' command. Note: any 'logging level <category> <level>' commands will have no visible effect after this, until the forced level is released.

param.name: debug
param.doc: Log debug messages and higher levels

param.name: info
param.doc: Log informational messages and higher levels

param.name: notice
param.doc: Log noticeable messages and higher levels

param.name: error
param.doc: Log error messages and higher levels

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: level
param.doc: Set the log level for a specified category

param.name: force-all
param.doc: Release any globally forced log level set with 'logging level force-all <level>'

param.name: logp
param.doc: Print a message on all log outputs; useful for placing markers in test logs

param.name: debug
param.doc: Log debug messages and higher levels

param.name: info
param.doc: Log informational messages and higher levels

param.name: notice
param.doc: Log noticeable messages and higher levels

param.name: error
param.doc: Log error messages and higher levels

param.name: .LOGMESSAGE
param.doc: Arbitrary message to log on given category and log level

param.name: vty
param.doc: Show current logging configuration for this vty

param.name: peer
param.doc: Show global and network peer related groups

param.name: subscriber
param.doc: Show global, peer, and subscriber groups

param.name: counters
param.doc: Generate table of all registered counters

param.name: all
param.doc: All contexts, if NULL-context tracking is enabled

param.name: full
param.doc: Display a full talloc memory hierarchy

param.name: brief
param.doc: Display a brief talloc memory hierarchy

param.doc: T- or X-timer-number -- 3GPP compliant timer number of the format '1234' or 'T1234' or 't1234'; Osmocom-specific timer number of the format: 'X1234' or 'x1234'.

param.doc: T- or X-timer-number -- 3GPP compliant timer number of the format '1234' or 'T1234' or 't1234'; Osmocom-specific timer number of the format: 'X1234' or 'x1234'.

Send all stats even if they have not changed (i.e. force the flush)every N-th reporting interval. Set to 0 to disable regular flush (default).

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: bind
param.doc: Accept VTY telnet connections on local interface

param.name: local-ip
param.doc: Set the IP address on which we listen for NS/UDP

param.name: local-port
param.doc: Set the UDP port on which we listen for NS/UDP

param.name: dscp
param.doc: Set DSCP/TOS on the UDP socket

param.name: use-reset-block-unblock
param.doc: Use NS-{RESET,BLOCK,UNBLOCK} procedures in violation of 3GPP TS 48.016

param.name: framerelay-gre
param.doc: NS over Frame Relay over GRE Encapsulation

param.name: enabled
param.doc: Enable or disable Frame Relay over GRE

param.name: framerelay-gre
param.doc: NS over Frame Relay over GRE Encapsulation

param.name: local-ip
param.doc: Set the IP address on which we listen for NS/FR/GRE

param.name: policy
param.doc: Set the scheduling policy to use for the process

param.name: rr
param.doc: Use the SCHED_RR real-time scheduling algorithm

param.name: cpu-affinity
param.doc: Set CPU affinity mask on a (group of) thread(s)

param.name: self
param.doc: Set CPU affinity mask on thread running the VTY

param.name: all
param.doc: Set CPU affinity mask on all process' threads
Set CPU affinity mask on a thread with specified PID

param.name: THREADNAME
param.doc: Set CPU affinity mask on a thread with specified thread name

param.name: [delay]
param.doc: If set, delay applying the affinity mask now and let the app handle it at a later point

param.name: only
param.doc: Use EGPRS and disable plain GPRS

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: two-phase-access
param.doc: Only use two phase access when requested my MS
Initial CS value to be used (overrides BTS config)
Use a different initial CS value for the uplink

param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: link-quality-ranges
param.doc: Set link quality ranges for each uplink CS

param.doc: Set quality range for CS-1 (high value only)

param.name: cs4
param.doc: Set quality range for CS-4 (low value only)

param.name: link-quality-ranges
param.doc: Set link quality ranges for each uplink MCS

param.doc: Set quality range for MCS-1 (high value only)

param.name: mcs9
param.doc: Set quality range for MCS-9 (low value only)

param.name: alloc-algorithm
param.doc: Select slot allocation algorithm to use when assigning timeslots on PACCH

param.name: b
param.doc: Multiple slots are assigned for semi-duplex operation

param.name: dynamic
param.doc: Dynamically select the algorithm based on the system state

param.name: two-phase-access
param.doc: Force two phase access when MS requests single phase access

param.name: flow-control-interval
param.doc: Interval between sending subsequent Flow Control PDUs

param.name: bucket-time
param.doc: Set target downlink maximum queueing time (only affects the advertised bucket size)

param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: bucket-time

param.name: alpha
param.doc: Alpha parameter for MS power control in units of 0.1 (see TS 05.08) NOTE: Be sure to set Alpha value at System information 13 too.

param.name: gamma
param.doc: Gamma parameter for MS power control in units of dB (see TS 05.08)
Gamma in even unit of dBs

param.name: dl-tbf-preemptive-retransmission
param.doc: retransmit blocks even before the MS had a chance to receive them (better throughput, less readable traces) (enabled by default)

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: dl-tbf-preemptive-retransmission
param.doc: retransmit blocks even before the MS had a chance to receive them (better throughput, less readable traces)

param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: pcu-socket
param.doc: Configure the osmo-bts PCU socket file/path name

param.name: PATH
param.doc: Path of the socket to connect to

param.name: gb-dialect
param.doc: Select which Gb interface dialect to use

param.name: classic
param.doc: Classic Gb interface with NS-{RESET,BLOCK,UNBLOCK} and static configuration

param.name: ip-sns
param.doc: Modern Gb interface with IP-SNS (Sub Network Service) and dynamic configuration

param.name: [TNNNN]
param.doc: T- or X-timer-number -- 3GPP compliant timer number of the format '1234' or 'T1234' or 't1234'; Osmocom-specific timer number of the format: 'X1234' or 'x1234'.
